abstract.p: Vegecyber Gourmet sells vegetarian foods at its store in Downtown Manhattan and over a Web site; photo (S)

block.p: A bright, friendly new source for dried, canned and frozen vegetarian foods is Vegecyber Gourmet, 210 Centre Street (Canal Street). ''Squid'' and ''shrimp'' made from yams, and a seaweed product called meat fluff are among the imitation meat and seafood items that line its shelves and freezers. The market also carries rice, noodles, teas, sweets and snacks, both Western and Asian. The manager, Louisa Wau (in light jacket) and her assistant, Judy Chan, are ready to help. A 20-ounce bag of quinoa is a bargain at $4.39. Packages of 36 frozen vegetable spring rolls, $7.50, can be deep-fried for quick and delicious hors d'oeuvres. And the fluff? It's $5.99 for a 16-ounce container.

A bright, friendly new source for dried, canned and frozen vegetarian foods is Vegecyber Gourmet, 210 Centre Street (Canal Street). ''Squid'' and ''shrimp'' made from yams, and a seaweed product called meat fluff are among the imitation meat and seafood items that line its shelves and freezers. The market also carries rice, noodles, teas, sweets and snacks, both Western and Asian. The manager, Louisa Wau (in light jacket) and her assistant, Judy Chan, are ready to help. A 20-ounce bag of quinoa is a bargain at $4.39. Packages of 36 frozen vegetable spring rolls, $7.50, can be deep-fried for quick and delicious hors d'oeuvres. And the fluff? It's $5.99 for a 16-ounce container.
True to its name, the store has a Web site, www.vegecyber.com, but right now it is available only in Chinese.
